intro: Psychotria maxonii, commonly known as the red Psychotria, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white or pale pink flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth. Psychotria maxonii is also known for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to fully understand its properties.
